name.en: Selected Readings on Theory of Ethnicity

goal.ch: 族群理論相當多樣，一般說來，包括原生論、工具論、情境論與建構論，或是認知角度（Brubaker 2002, Brubaker and Loveman 2004），抑或是新自由主義國家治理（黃應貴等 2018）的視角切入族群研究。其中，最常應用的則是Fredrik Barth於1969年的族群邊界理論，該理論為族群研究開啟新頁，然而距其發表理論已超過五十年的時間，該理論有其未能注意的部份，例如國家的角色。再加上，隨著時代變化，某些現象是過去理論無法顧及的，例如全球移動所引發的文化混雜現。因此，本課程希望從Barth的族群邊界作為探討族群理論的出發點，接著探討其後續的批判與延伸的議題――「國家角色」、「原住民政策」、「都會族群性、移民與跨國主義」、「混雜性與邊界模糊性」、「族群衝突」、「後殖民主義、仇外、肯認政治」、「族群認同之於文化的關係」、「族群整合之相對性」。以此做為課程架構，希冀能夠深化同學對於族群理論的了解。
goal.en:
Ethnic theories are quite diverse. Generally 
speaking, they include primordialism, instrumentalism, situationalism, and constructionism, or from 
cognitive perspectives (Brubaker 2002, Brubaker and Loveman 2004), or from neoliberal national 
governance (Huang Yinggui et al. 2018). 
These perspectives pave ways for us to enter into ethnic studies. Among them, the most commonly used is Fredrik Barth‘s ethnic boundary theory in 
1969. This theory opened a new page for ethnic 
studies. However, it has been more than fifty 
years since its publication, and this theory has its parts that have not been paid attention to, such as the role of the state. In addition, as the times has changed, certain phenomena cannot be taken into account by past theories, such as the cultural 
hybridization caused by global movement. 
Therefore, this course hopes to use Barth‘s ethnic boundaries as the starting point to explore theory on ethnic studies, and then explore its subsequent criticism and extended issues - “the state“, 
“indigenous politics“, “urban ethnicity, migration 
and transnationalism“ , “hybridity and the
fuzziness of boundaries“, “ethnic conflict“, 
“postcolonialism, xenophobia and the politics of recognition“, “the relationship of ethnic Identity to 
culture“, “the relativity of group Integration“. Using this as a course structure, 
students‘ understanding of ethnic theory will be 
deepened.
